title: AI Tools From SurveyMonkey Aim to Speed up Survey Insights
optimized_headline: SurveyMonkey's New AI Tools Promise Faster Insights for Your Surveys
raw_excerpt: New features include Analyze with AI, a chat-based analysis tool that offers quick insights and data segmentation.
raw_body: New features include Analyze with AI, a chat-based analysis tool that offers quick insights and data segmentation.
speedrun: SurveyMonkey has introduced new AI tools aimed at accelerating survey insights. The key feature, Analyze with AI, utilizes a chat-based interface to provide quick analysis and data segmentation. This innovation could help users interpret their survey results faster and more effectively. As businesses increasingly rely on data-driven decisions, these tools are timely and relevant.
why_it_matters: Businesses and researchers can now gain insights more quickly, streamlining decision-making processes.
This development reflects a growing trend toward integrating AI in data analysis, suggesting a shift in how organizations leverage technology for insights.

lenses.eli12: SurveyMonkey's new AI tools help users get answers from surveys faster, almost like having a conversation with a knowledgeable friend. The chat-based feature makes it easier to understand complex data. This matters because quicker insights can lead to better decisions in everyday life, whether for businesses or personal projects.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, these AI tools address the need for faster data analysis, reducing the time spent on interpreting survey results. This efficiency could lower costs associated with data processing. The practical implication is that teams can focus more on strategy and less on data crunching.
lenses.engineer: The Analyze with AI feature employs natural language processing to facilitate chat-based interactions for data analysis. This allows users to quickly segment and interpret survey data without extensive training. While specific models or benchmarks weren't detailed, the emphasis on speed and user-friendliness highlights a shift toward accessible AI tools.
